The Choirs of East Grand Rapids High School had their Holiday Choral Music Around the World concert Monday night. The pre-concert music was provided by harpist Ella Webb on stage while the Madrigals caroled in the lobby.

The Women's Chorus, Men's Chorus, Varsity Voices, Bella Voce and the Madrigals all performed beautiful holiday carols from Austria, Japan, Spain, Israel, England, France, Scotland, Germany and many of the American classics such as Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas performed by Bella Voce joined by alumni who were in attendance.

There was also a special moment with Santa Claus (Bruce Towne), as Dr. Borst and the choirs wished him a fond farewell.

The High School Choir Department hosted their 6th Annual Choral Kick-Off Informance on Monday, September 16th. The Madrigals started the event with the National Anthem followed by Mr. Wilkie playing a piano solo then Women's Chorus, Bella Voce, Men's Chorus, Varsity Voices and Madrigals signing one song each. The Michigan Science Olympiad State Tournament took place at MSU this past weekend. For the first time ever, both our High School and Middle School Science Olympiad teams qualified and competed at this competitive event. The photo below is of both teams and their coaches.

The teams received medals in three events. Seniors, Bailey Burke and Kate Geller, took 3rd place in Designer Genes. Xiangyu Chen and Joe Rao took 4th place in Fermi Questions. Alex Bruce and Max Bruce placed 7th in Geologic Mapping. The team also included Clay Christoffersen, Elsa Hossain, Jacob VandenBosch, Max West, Norah Murphy, and Tejas Iyer. The team placed 35th out of 60 teams.

Great work everyone!
